page.title: 20WORSHIP IN THE AREA
page.content: {Church of England}congregations meet in{Boconnoc Church}and the church at{St.Veep,}there is no parish church in{Lerryn. There is a{Methodist Church}at {Couch's Mill. The{methodist}chapel in Lerryn has been closed and converted into flats. {Boconnoc Church's}dedication is unknown,it contains old roof timbers from Boconnoc House and old oak floor boards also having come from the house. There is a{Minstrel's Gallery at the West end, and the family pew contains 14 beautiful chairs. The {altar table}is carved wood and is inscribed with the{date 1621. }On the North wall there is the{Royal Coat {of Arms}and above the South door is a letter of thanks from{King Charles 1 for the{Cornish Victory of 1643.
